mechanism: Maillard reaction (amine + reducing sugar) → Schiff base/Amadori → browning
key_finding: Amines react with lactose in solid state via Maillard; discoloration/degradation documented.
source: Wu et al., Reactive Impurities in Excipients (2011)

mechanism: Maillard reaction for secondary amines with lactose
key_finding: Secondary amines show Maillard products with lactose under stress.
source: Wirth et al., J Pharm Sci

key_finding: Amine–lactose incompatibility widely reported in literature reviews.
β‑lactam amines with lactose under humidity: high incompatibility risk.
Increasing Mg stearate reduces dissolution of ranitidine tablets.

mechanism: Hydrophobic film slows dissolution of acidic drugs
key_finding: Mg stearate retards dissolution of acidic model drugs (classic study).
Hydrophobic films reduce wetting and release for poorly soluble APIs.
Lubricant sensitivity common for weak acids; Mg stearate lowers dissolution.

mechanism: Hygroscopic PVP elevates moisture → ester hydrolysis
key_finding: PVP is strongly hygroscopic; moisture accelerates aspirin hydrolysis to salicylic acid.

mechanism: Acid–base/salt formation risk with basic calcium salt
key_finding: Acidic APIs may be incompatible with calcium phosphates; DSC evidence.

mechanism: Local pH/Na+ exchange can affect weak bases
key_finding: SSG Type A pH 5.5–7.5; sodium content shifts microenvironment pH.

mechanism: Adsorption via H‑bonding to silica surface
key_finding: Phenolics can hydrogen‑bond to silica; adsorption can impact release.

mechanism: Hygroscopic HPMC raises water activity → color change risk if lactose present
key_finding: HPMC coats absorb moisture; coatings alter water activity.

mechanism: Method & acceptance criteria for IR disintegration
key_finding: Harmonized chapter for disintegration tests (IR tablets/capsules).

mechanism: Apparatus & acceptance; typical IR Q ≈ 80%/30 min (monograph‑specific)
key_finding: Method development per <1092>; monograph defines criteria.
25°C/60%RH; 30°C/65%RH; 40°C/75%RH (zone dependent).
Amine–silica interactions documented via spectroscopy and modeling.
Amines with lactose form imines/Amadori products upon stress.
Hydrophobic film & potential surface interactions; stabilize via antioxidants.

mechanism: Moisture uptake by HPMC raises water activity
key_finding: Polymer hygroscopicity can impact moisture‑sensitive macrolides.
Moisture-mediated hydrolysis of ester prodrugs enhanced by hygroscopic PVP.
Some basic/acidic APIs interact with DCP; check DSC/compatibility.
Alkaline microenvironment increases dissolution of weak acids.
Acid‑labile bases generally need enteric/buffer systems; lactose not protective.

mechanism: Moisture sorption isotherms; RH‑dependent mass gain
key_finding: Film coats exhibit moisture sorption; affects stability/disintegration.
